Node.definition: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
= process by which young human offspring goes through the process of birth
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= process by which males among humans and animals generate offspring

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which humans lack physical strength; ◄ caused by sickness or injury
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

= action by which human perform the mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include wailing (ילל) tearing one's clothes, putting on sackcloth (שַׂק) covering oneself with dust or ashes, fasting (צום) or eating specific food, cutting oneself (גדד) shaving one's head (קרח) covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

= to put the body of someone who died in a designated place, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or in a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, but also with honor and respect
= excrement; ◄ produced by animals; ► source of pollution and impurity; ≈ regarded as filthy and only good as fertilizer

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)
literally: to finish; hence: = process by which humans and objects completely disappear from existence
= the dead body of humans or animals
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= action by which human perform the mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include wailing (ילל) tearing one's clothes, putting on sackcloth (שַׂק) covering oneself with dust or ashes, fasting (צום) or eating specific food, cutting oneself (גדד) shaving one's head (קרח) covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event
literally: to shake (one's) head); hence: = action by which humans turn their head from one side to the other ► to express sympathy
= action by which someone brings an event to an end

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom
= state in which humans are of relatively low esteem

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= to put the body of someone who died in a designated place, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or in a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, but also with honor and respect

= action by which human perform the mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include wailing (ילל) tearing one's clothes, putting on sackcloth (שַׂק) covering oneself with dust or ashes, fasting (צום) or eating specific food, cutting oneself (גדד) shaving one's head (קרח) covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

Node.gloss: to cut oneself|to gash oneself|to lacerate oneself
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans inflict wounds on their body with a knife, ► as a sign of mourning, or in order to reinforce one's prayer
= action by which a human being uses a sharp implement to remove the hair from (part of) his scalp, ► as a sign of mourning
= a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= small, bowl shaped container ► used for drinking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote one's portion in life, received from God
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
literally: drinking; hence: = a banquet meal or feast with honored guests
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= man who is about to be married or has just been married; ≈ often associated with joy
= woman who is about to be married or has just been married; ≈ often associated with joy

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= state in which an event has a high intensity

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
= indirect male progenitor

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is committed to follow Y's leadership and example
plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

= action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity, perform the required rituals, and live in accordance with the requirements of that deity
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse

Node.gloss: to act wickedly|to do wickedness|to do evil
Node.definition: literally: to act wickedly (by doing); hence: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= indirect male progenitor
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is committed to follow Y's leadership and example
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= particle marking a proposition as not true
literally: to hurl; = causative action by which deities use force to cause people to leave their country

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= indirect male progenitor

= action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity, perform the required rituals, and live in accordance with the requirements of that deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= during the daytime
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
literally: to give mercy; hence: = action by which deities experience an emotion of compassion towards humans, and act accordingly
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= set of particles marking an object or event as opposed to other objects and events

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to drive out|to cast out|to disperse
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to leave their place or position using force

Node.gloss: to take back|to bring back|to return|to put back|to restore (something)
Node.definition: literally: to turn; hence: = causative action by which animals, humans, deities cause (other) animals, humans, or objects to move back to a location where they have been before

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= indirect male progenitor
= causative action by which humans or deities send people though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly to summon another person or group
= a person who catches fish for a living
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which someone catches fish with a line and hook or with nets, traps, etc.
= referent to the time after the event in focus
= causative action by which humans or deities send people though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly to summon another person or group
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= a person who tracks and catches animals, ► usually to kill them for food

= causative action by which humans or animals make an effort to capture or kill (other) animals, sometimes with the help of devices such as weapons and traps; ► usually with the intention of killing and eating them; ≈ implies using stealth to locate and pursue the quarry, often used metaphorically to refer acts of aggression towards people or events to get other people in one's power
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= a narrow opening or long, narrow crack in a rock; ≈ regarded as a suitable place for hiding

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which certain information is not generally known, ◄ as if it were physically hidden
= causative action by which humans keep information hidden from deities
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= causative action by which humans (or deities by human hands) cause land, buildings, or other objects to be unfit for religious use ◄ usually by unlawful behavior

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: corpse; hence: = the image of an idol described in very derogatory terms as a lifeless object

= a reference to the physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing, ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship, ≈ with a very strong added connotation of something utterly detestable

= a reference to the physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing, ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship, ≈ with a very strong added connotation of something utterly detestable

= causative action or process by which deities cause a location to be dominated by a certain activity, to the extent that it dominates everything else, ◄ as if it were completely filled with that event

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

Node.gloss: ends of the earth > all people on earth
Node.definition: literally: ends of the earth; hence: = all people on earth, including those living in its remotest corners

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= state in which objects or activities do not serve a valid purpose and can only lead to disappointment
= action by which humans or deities take permanent possession of objects, humans, or property, either by inheritance or force
= indirect male progenitor
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= causative process by which certain objects or activities promote someone's well being
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
